entry.title: Thinzar Shunlei Yi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Thinzar Shunlei Yi (pictured) hid in the Burmese jungle for a month and joined a rebel militia following the 2021 Myanmar coup d'état?

entry.title: Milwaukee Cold Storage Co. Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1892 Milwaukee Cold Storage Co. Building has very few windows, and walls which are two feet (0.6 m) thick?

entry.title: Angelo Emo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Venetian admiral Angelo Emo invented floating artillery batteries on rafts during his campaign against the Beylik of Tunis?

entry.title: a San Antonio TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a San Antonio TV station lost its Fox affiliation on twelve days' notice to the public?

entry.title: Alfred Verdross (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the 1930s Alfred Verdross, an Austrian international lawyer and future judge of the European Court of Human Rights, sympathised with National Socialism?

entry.title: Abu Dhabi Marathon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although he was expected to exit the race after about 30 km (19 mi), pacemaker Reuben Kipyego ended up winning the 2019 Abu Dhabi Marathon and US$100,000?

entry.title: Gordon Ellis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the maritime painter Gordon Ellis had his first commission published when he was just 13 years old?

entry.title: 1978 World Snooker Championship (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the 1978 World Snooker Championship, Fred Davis reached the semi-finals at the age of 64?
